result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer May Bertrand

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Defendant Jennifer May Bertrand in court.  Attorney Mitchell Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has contacted the PD, but did not qualify.
Believes she qualifies now due to circumstance change.
Deft heard on bond modification.
Court denies motion.
Court schedules with parties.
9:15 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:51 AM Defendant Jennifer May Bertrand appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Deft does not qualify for PD representation.
Atty Spansail provides dean form.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft's mother-in-law is present in the courtroom and is present.
Court imposes $500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact with known drug users or sellers, may not leave the state of Wisconsin, may not have custody of children until the matter is taken care of with the juvenile court, may visit the children with supervision only and in a public place and only with the current custodial gaurdian.
Court schedules with parties.
11:56 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
